abstract.p: Verizon Wireless names New York office of Hill, Holliday, Connors, Cosmopulos to handle its Northeast retail ad account (S)

block.p: Verizon Wireless, a joint venture of Verizon Communications and Vodafone said yesterday that it had named the New York office of Hill, Holliday, Connors, Cosmopulos, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, to handle its Northeast retail account. Billings were estimated at $50 million.

Nancy Stark, a spokeswoman for Verizon in Bedminster, N.J., declined to identify the finalists in a review for the assignment. Adweek listed them as Hill, Holliday and two other New York agencies: Berenter Greenhouse & Webster, part of the Bozell Group unit of True North Communications, and Lowe Lintas & Partners, part of the Lowe Group unit of Interpublic.

The Bozell New York office had handled the bulk of the Northeast retail account and continues handling national brand advertising for Verizon Wireless.
